name: Wide-grip Pulldown
how_to_perform:
1. Start by sitting at a wide-grip pulldown machine with your knees securely under the knee pad.

2. Grasp the bar with a shoulder-width overhand grip, your hands shoulder-width apart and your palms facing away from you.

3. Engage your core muscles by pulling your belly button towards your spine.

4. Squeeze your shoulder blades together to maintain proper posture and tension in your upper body.

5. With your back straight and your core engaged, slowly lift the bar down towards your chest, drawing your elbows close to your sides as you pull.

6. Focus on using your latissimus dorsi muscles to pull the bar, keeping your shoulders down and away from your ears.

7. Lower the bar back to its starting position, extending your arms fully and releasing any tension in your upper body.

8. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, maintaining proper form throughout each rep.
short_summary: Wide-grip pulldowns are a lat-focused exercise that targets multiple muscle groups, performed using a wide-grip pulldown machine.
